alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 3:29PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM HST THIS EVENING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 630 PM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over the Puna district and parts of South Hilo and Kau districts. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 2.5 inches per hour with the heaviest rain near Volcano. Additional heavy showers will be possible during the next several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Glenwood, Volcano, Mountain View, Hawaiian Acres, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Orchidland Estates, Keaau, Pahoa, Papaikou, Wood Valley, Pahala, Fern Forest, Eden Roc, Fern Acres, Kurtistown, Ainaloa and Kalapana. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 630 PM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
